job_title: Library Circulation Assistant in Kansas City, MO
pros: Flexibility with schedule, being surrounded by lots of great theological resources, being on campus if you are a student, healthy work environment. Helping people find research resources so that they can succeed and be shaped by their theological education.
cons: The pay is on the lower side, but it's also important to note that it's usually students who are working in this particular position, and students tend to hold the position for a short amount of time. But the pros outweigh this one con!

job_title: Library Circulation Assistant in Kansas City, MO
pros: • You to help students find biblical and theological resources • Connect with others on campus through the library • Learn valuable research and library related skills • Healthy work environment
cons: Truly, the only con is that the pay is a bit low. Otherwise, it’s a job worth having.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Kansas City, MO
pros: The classes are set up for you.
cons: They continue to add more work and reduce your pay.

pros: this seminary truly cares for their people

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Kansas City, MO
pros: Best SBC College and Seminary to work for.
cons: There is a high turnover due to people graduating. To "work your way up" you have to stay for awhile.

job_title: Full Time in Kansas City, MO
pros:
They are extremely helpful as far as family life is concerned. 
Focused on bettering those who work for them and those who attend.
Organizational culture is constantly improving.
Rent on campus is quite cheap comparatively and cable/utilities are bundled in together.
cons:
Organizational culture is not yet at the level of other comparable schools.
Intra-organization communication is lacking at times

job_title: Network Administrator in Kansas City, MO
pros: The faculty, staff, and students are sincere Christians. The exhibit character qualities such as authenticity, patience, kindness, generosity.
cons: The payscale is lower than average.
